utils.visualization.movie_generatorÂ¶

Source: src\utils\visualization\movie_generator.py

Module OverviewÂ¶

Complete visualization plan for the entire DIP control project.

Provides comprehensive movie generation capabilities for documenting and presenting the complete control engineering project with professional quality animations and analysis visualizations.

Complete Source CodeÂ¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#===================== src/utils/visualization/movie_generator.py =====================\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""
  6Complete visualization plan for the entire DIP control project.
  7
  8Provides comprehensive movie generation capabilities for documenting
  9and presenting the complete control engineering project with professional
 10quality animations and analysis visualizations.
 11"""
 12
 13from __future__ import annotations
 14import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
 15import matplotlib.animation as animation
 16import numpy as np
 17from typing import List, Dict, Any, Optional, Tuple
 18import os
 19from dataclasses import dataclass
 20from .animation import DIPAnimator, MultiSystemAnimator
 21from .static_plots import ControlPlotter, SystemVisualization
 22
 23@dataclass
 24class MovieScene:
 25    """Configuration for a movie scene."""
 26    title: str
 27    duration: float  # seconds
 28    data: Dict[str, Any]
 29    scene_type: str  # 'animation', 'static', 'comparison', 'analysis'
 30    description: str
 31
 32class ProjectMovieGenerator:
 33    """
 34    Complete visualization plan generator for the entire DIP control project.
 35
 36    Creates professional-quality movies that document:
 37    - System dynamics and behavior
 38    - Control algorithm performance
 39    - Comparison studies
 40    - Optimization results
 41    - Statistical analysis
 42    """
 43
 44    def __init__(self, output_dir: str = "project_movies"):
 45        """Initialize movie generator."""
 46        self.output_dir = output_dir
 47        os.makedirs(output_dir, exist_ok=True)
 48
 49        self.animator = DIPAnimator(None)
 50        self.plotter = ControlPlotter()
 51        self.system_viz = SystemVisualization()
 52
 53    def create_complete_project_movie(
 54        self,
 55        project_data: Dict[str, Any],
 56        movie_title: str = "DIP Control Engineering Project",
 57        fps: int = 30
 58    ) -> str:
 59        """
 60        Create a complete movie documenting the entire project.
 61
 62        Movie Structure:
 63        1. Introduction and system overview
 64        2. Plant dynamics demonstration
 65        3. Controller implementations
 66        4. Comparative analysis
 67        5. Optimization results
 68        6. Statistical validation
 69        7. Conclusions and future work
 70        """
 71
 72        scenes = self._create_movie_scenes(project_data)
 73        movie_path = os.path.join(self.output_dir, f"{movie_title.replace(' ', '_')}.mp4")
 74
 75        return self._compile_scenes_to_movie(scenes, movie_path, fps)
 76
 77    def _create_movie_scenes(self, project_data: Dict[str, Any]) -> List[MovieScene]:
 78        """Create all movie scenes for the complete project documentation."""
 79
 80        scenes = []
 81
 82        # Scene 1: Project Introduction
 83        scenes.append(MovieScene(
 84            title="Project Introduction",
 85            duration=10.0,
 86            data=project_data.get('overview', {}),
 87            scene_type='static',
 88            description="Overview of the double inverted pendulum control project"
 89        ))
 90
 91        # Scene 2: System Dynamics
 92        scenes.append(MovieScene(
 93            title="System Dynamics",
 94            duration=15.0,
 95            data=project_data.get('plant_dynamics', {}),
 96            scene_type='animation',
 97            description="Demonstration of uncontrolled system dynamics"
 98        ))
 99
100        # Scene 3: Controller Implementations
101        for controller_name, controller_data in project_data.get('controllers', {}).items():
102            scenes.append(MovieScene(
103                title=f"{controller_name} Controller",
104                duration=20.0,
105                data=controller_data,
106                scene_type='animation',
107                description=f"Performance demonstration of {controller_name}"
108            ))
109
110        # Scene 4: Comparative Analysis
111        scenes.append(MovieScene(
112            title="Controller Comparison",
113            duration=25.0,
114            data=project_data.get('comparison', {}),
115            scene_type='comparison',
116            description="Side-by-side comparison of all controllers"
117        ))
118
119        # Scene 5: Optimization Results
120        if 'optimization' in project_data:
121            scenes.append(MovieScene(
122                title="Parameter Optimization",
123                duration=20.0,
124                data=project_data['optimization'],
125                scene_type='analysis',
126                description="PSO optimization results and convergence"
127            ))
128
129        # Scene 6: Statistical Analysis
130        if 'statistics' in project_data:
131            scenes.append(MovieScene(
132                title="Statistical Validation",
133                duration=15.0,
134                data=project_data['statistics'],
135                scene_type='analysis',
136                description="Monte Carlo analysis and confidence intervals"
137            ))
138
139        # Scene 7: Robustness Analysis
140        if 'robustness' in project_data:
141            scenes.append(MovieScene(
142                title="Robustness Analysis",
143                duration=18.0,
144                data=project_data['robustness'],
145                scene_type='analysis',
146                description="System performance under uncertainties"
147            ))
148
149        return scenes
150
151    def _compile_scenes_to_movie(self, scenes: List[MovieScene], output_path: str, fps: int) -> str:
152        """Compile all scenes into a single movie file."""
153
154        # Create individual scene animations
155        scene_files = []
156
157        for i, scene in enumerate(scenes):
158            scene_path = os.path.join(self.output_dir, f"scene_{i:02d}_{scene.title.replace(' ', '_')}.mp4")
159
160            if scene.scene_type == 'animation':
161                self._create_animation_scene(scene, scene_path, fps)
162            elif scene.scene_type == 'static':
163                self._create_static_scene(scene, scene_path, fps)
164            elif scene.scene_type == 'comparison':
165                self._create_comparison_scene(scene, scene_path, fps)
166            elif scene.scene_type == 'analysis':
167                self._create_analysis_scene(scene, scene_path, fps)
168
169            scene_files.append(scene_path)
170
171        # Compile scenes using ffmpeg (if available)
172        try:
173            self._merge_videos(scene_files, output_path)
174        except Exception as e:
175            print(f"Video compilation failed: {e}")
176            print("Individual scene files created successfully:")
177            for file in scene_files:
178                print(f"  - {file}")
179
180        return output_path
181
182    def _create_animation_scene(self, scene: MovieScene, output_path: str, fps: int) -> None:
183        """Create an animated scene."""
184        data = scene.data
185
186        # Extract simulation data
187        time_history = data.get('time', [])
188        state_history = data.get('states', [])
189        control_history = data.get('controls', [])
190
191        if not all([time_history, state_history, control_history]):
192            print(f"Warning: Insufficient data for animation scene '{scene.title}'")
193            return
194
195        # Create animation
196        animator = DIPAnimator(None, figsize=(16, 9))
197
198        # Add title and description
199        animator.fig.suptitle(scene.title, fontsize=20, fontweight='bold')
200        animator.ax.text(0.02, 0.02, scene.description, transform=animator.ax.transAxes,
201                        fontsize=12, bbox=dict(boxstyle="round", facecolor="white", alpha=0.9))
202
203        # Save animation
204        animator.save_animation(state_history, control_history, time_history, output_path, fps=fps)
205
206    def _create_static_scene(self, scene: MovieScene, output_path: str, fps: int) -> None:
207        """Create a static information scene."""
208        fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(16, 9))
209
210        # Create informational slide
211        ax.text(0.5, 0.8, scene.title, ha='center', va='center', fontsize=32, fontweight='bold')
212        ax.text(0.5, 0.6, scene.description, ha='center', va='center', fontsize=18, wrap=True)
213
214        # Add project information
215        if 'project_info' in scene.data:
216            info_text = self._format_project_info(scene.data['project_info'])
217            ax.text(0.5, 0.3, info_text, ha='center', va='center', fontsize=14)
218
219        ax.set_xlim(0, 1)
220        ax.set_ylim(0, 1)
221        ax.axis('off')
222
223        # Save as static video (repeated frames)
224        frames = int(scene.duration * fps)
225
226        def animate_static(frame):
227            return []
228
229        anim = animation.FuncAnimation(fig, animate_static, frames=frames, interval=1000/fps)
230        anim.save(output_path, writer='pillow', fps=fps)
231        plt.close(fig)
232
233    def _create_comparison_scene(self, scene: MovieScene, output_path: str, fps: int) -> None:
234        """Create a controller comparison scene."""
235        data = scene.data
236        controllers = data.get('controllers', {})
237
238        if len(controllers) < 2:
239            print(f"Warning: Not enough controllers for comparison scene '{scene.title}'")
240            return
241
242        # Prepare data for multi-system animation
243        systems_data = []
244        for name, controller_data in controllers.items():
245            systems_data.append((
246                name,
247                controller_data.get('states', []),
248                controller_data.get('controls', []),
249                controller_data.get('time', [])
250            ))
251
252        # Create multi-system animator
253        multi_animator = MultiSystemAnimator(len(systems_data), figsize=(20, 10))
254
255        # Add overall title
256        multi_animator.fig.suptitle(scene.title, fontsize=20, fontweight='bold')
257
258        # Create and save animation
259        anim = multi_animator.create_comparison_animation(systems_data, interval=1000//fps)
260        anim.save(output_path, writer='pillow', fps=fps)
261        plt.close(multi_animator.fig)
262
263    def _create_analysis_scene(self, scene: MovieScene, output_path: str, fps: int) -> None:
264        """Create an analysis visualization scene."""
265        data = scene.data
266
267        # Create analysis plots
268        fig = plt.figure(figsize=(16, 9))
269
270        if scene.title == "Parameter Optimization":
271            self._create_optimization_analysis(fig, data)
272        elif scene.title == "Statistical Validation":
273            self._create_statistical_analysis(fig, data)
274        elif scene.title == "Robustness Analysis":
275            self._create_robustness_analysis(fig, data)
276
277        fig.suptitle(scene.title, fontsize=20, fontweight='bold')
278
279        # Save as animated plot progression
280        frames = int(scene.duration * fps)
281
282        def animate_analysis(frame):
283            # Gradually reveal analysis results
284            alpha = min(1.0, frame / (frames * 0.3))
285            for ax in fig.get_axes():
286                for artist in ax.get_children():
287                    if hasattr(artist, 'set_alpha'):
288                        artist.set_alpha(alpha)
289            return fig.get_children()
290
291        anim = animation.FuncAnimation(fig, animate_analysis, frames=frames, interval=1000/fps)
292        anim.save(output_path, writer='pillow', fps=fps)
293        plt.close(fig)
294
295    def _create_optimization_analysis(self, fig: plt.Figure, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> None:
296        """Create PSO optimization analysis plots."""
297        gs = fig.add_gridspec(2, 2)
298
299        # Convergence plot
300        ax1 = fig.add_subplot(gs[0, :])
301        if 'convergence' in data:
302            ax1.plot(data['convergence'], linewidth=2)
303            ax1.set_title("PSO Convergence")
304            ax1.set_xlabel("Iteration")
305            ax1.set_ylabel("Best Fitness")
306            ax1.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
307
308        # Parameter evolution
309        ax2 = fig.add_subplot(gs[1, 0])
310        if 'parameter_evolution' in data:
311            for i, param_hist in enumerate(data['parameter_evolution']):
312                ax2.plot(param_hist, label=f'Param {i+1}')
313            ax2.set_title("Parameter Evolution")
314            ax2.set_xlabel("Iteration")
315            ax2.legend()
316            ax2.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
317
318        # Final performance
319        ax3 = fig.add_subplot(gs[1, 1])
320        if 'final_performance' in data:
321            performance = data['final_performance']
322            ax3.bar(performance.keys(), performance.values())
323            ax3.set_title("Final Performance Metrics")
324            ax3.tick_params(axis='x', rotation=45)
325
326    def _create_statistical_analysis(self, fig: plt.Figure, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> None:
327        """Create statistical analysis plots."""
328        gs = fig.add_gridspec(2, 2)
329
330        # Performance distributions
331        ax1 = fig.add_subplot(gs[0, :])
332        if 'performance_distributions' in data:
333            for controller, values in data['performance_distributions'].items():
334                ax1.hist(values, alpha=0.7, label=controller, bins=30)
335            ax1.set_title("Performance Distributions")
336            ax1.set_xlabel("Performance Metric")
337            ax1.set_ylabel("Frequency")
338            ax1.legend()
339            ax1.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
340
341        # Confidence intervals
342        ax2 = fig.add_subplot(gs[1, 0])
343        if 'confidence_intervals' in data:
344            controllers = list(data['confidence_intervals'].keys())
345            means = [data['confidence_intervals'][c]['mean'] for c in controllers]
346            errors = [data['confidence_intervals'][c]['error'] for c in controllers]
347            ax2.errorbar(range(len(controllers)), means, yerr=errors, fmt='o', capsize=5)
348            ax2.set_xticks(range(len(controllers)))
349            ax2.set_xticklabels(controllers, rotation=45)
350            ax2.set_title("Performance Confidence Intervals")
351            ax2.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
352
353    def _format_project_info(self, info: Dict[str, Any]) -> str:
354        """Format project information for display."""
355        lines = []
356        for key, value in info.items():
357            lines.append(f"{key}: {value}")
358        return "\n".join(lines)
359
360    def _merge_videos(self, video_files: List[str], output_path: str) -> None:
361        """Merge multiple video files using ffmpeg."""
362        import subprocess
363
364        # Create file list for ffmpeg
365        list_file = os.path.join(self.output_dir, "video_list.txt")
366        with open(list_file, 'w') as f:
367            for video_file in video_files:
368                f.write(f"file '{video_file}'\n")
369
370        # Run ffmpeg
371        cmd = [
372            'ffmpeg', '-f', 'concat', '-safe', '0', '-i', list_file,
373            '-c', 'copy', output_path, '-y'
374        ]
375
376        subprocess.run(cmd, check=True)
377        os.remove(list_file)
378
379    def create_project_trailer(self, project_data: Dict[str, Any], duration: float = 60.0) -> str:
380        """Create a short trailer/summary of the project."""
381        trailer_data = {
382            'overview': project_data.get('overview', {}),
383            'highlights': self._extract_highlights(project_data),
384            'results_summary': self._summarize_results(project_data)
385        }
386
387        trailer_path = os.path.join(self.output_dir, "project_trailer.mp4")
388
389        # Create condensed version of key scenes
390        scenes = [
391            MovieScene("Project Overview", 10.0, trailer_data['overview'], 'static',
392                      "Brief introduction to the DIP control project"),
393            MovieScene("Key Results", 30.0, trailer_data['highlights'], 'comparison',
394                      "Highlights of controller performance"),
395            MovieScene("Summary", 20.0, trailer_data['results_summary'], 'analysis',
396                      "Summary of achievements and conclusions")
397        ]
398
399        return self._compile_scenes_to_movie(scenes, trailer_path, fps=30)
400
401    def _extract_highlights(self, project_data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
402        """Extract highlight results for trailer."""
403        # Select best performing controllers and key results
404        highlights = {}
405
406        if 'controllers' in project_data:
407            # Select top 2-3 performing controllers
408            controllers = project_data['controllers']
409            highlights['controllers'] = dict(list(controllers.items())[:3])
410
411        return highlights
412
413    def _summarize_results(self, project_data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
414        """Summarize key project results."""
415        summary = {}
416
417        if 'final_metrics' in project_data:
418            summary['metrics'] = project_data['final_metrics']
419
420        if 'conclusions' in project_data:
421            summary['conclusions'] = project_data['conclusions']
422
423        return summary

ClassesÂ¶

MovieSceneÂ¶

Configuration for a movie scene.

Source CodeÂ¶

1@dataclass
2class MovieScene:
3    """Configuration for a movie scene."""
4    title: str
5    duration: float  # seconds
6    data: Dict[str, Any]
7    scene_type: str  # 'animation', 'static', 'comparison', 'analysis'
8    description: str

ProjectMovieGeneratorÂ¶

Complete visualization plan generator for the entire DIP control project.

Creates professional-quality movies that document:

  • System dynamics and behavior

  • Control algorithm performance

  • Comparison studies

  • Optimization results

  • Statistical analysis

Source CodeÂ¶

  1class ProjectMovieGenerator:
  2    """
  3    Complete visualization plan generator for the entire DIP control project.
  4
  5    Creates professional-quality movies that document:
  6    - System dynamics and behavior
  7    - Control algorithm performance
  8    - Comparison studies
  9    - Optimization results
 10    - Statistical analysis
 11    """
 12
 13    def __init__(self, output_dir: str = "project_movies"):
 14        """Initialize movie generator."""
 15        self.output_dir = output_dir
 16        os.makedirs(output_dir, exist_ok=True)
 17
 18        self.animator = DIPAnimator(None)
 19        self.plotter = ControlPlotter()
 20        self.system_viz = SystemVisualization()
 21
 22    def create_complete_project_movie(
 23        self,
 24        project_data: Dict[str, Any],
 25        movie_title: str = "DIP Control Engineering Project",
 26        fps: int = 30
 27    ) -> str:
 28        """
 29        Create a complete movie documenting the entire project.
 30
 31        Movie Structure:
 32        1. Introduction and system overview
 33        2. Plant dynamics demonstration
 34        3. Controller implementations
 35        4. Comparative analysis
 36        5. Optimization results
 37        6. Statistical validation
 38        7. Conclusions and future work
 39        """
 40
 41        scenes = self._create_movie_scenes(project_data)
 42        movie_path = os.path.join(self.output_dir, f"{movie_title.replace(' ', '_')}.mp4")
 43
 44        return self._compile_scenes_to_movie(scenes, movie_path, fps)
 45
 46    def _create_movie_scenes(self, project_data: Dict[str, Any]) -> List[MovieScene]:
 47        """Create all movie scenes for the complete project documentation."""
 48
 49        scenes = []
 50
 51        # Scene 1: Project Introduction
 52        scenes.append(MovieScene(
 53            title="Project Introduction",
 54            duration=10.0,
 55            data=project_data.get('overview', {}),
 56            scene_type='static',
 57            description="Overview of the double inverted pendulum control project"
 58        ))
 59
 60        # Scene 2: System Dynamics
 61        scenes.append(MovieScene(
 62            title="System Dynamics",
 63            duration=15.0,
 64            data=project_data.get('plant_dynamics', {}),
 65            scene_type='animation',
 66            description="Demonstration of uncontrolled system dynamics"
 67        ))
 68
 69        # Scene 3: Controller Implementations
 70        for controller_name, controller_data in project_data.get('controllers', {}).items():
 71            scenes.append(MovieScene(
 72                title=f"{controller_name} Controller",
 73                duration=20.0,
 74                data=controller_data,
 75                scene_type='animation',
 76                description=f"Performance demonstration of {controller_name}"
 77            ))
 78
 79        # Scene 4: Comparative Analysis
 80        scenes.append(MovieScene(
 81            title="Controller Comparison",
 82            duration=25.0,
 83            data=project_data.get('comparison', {}),
 84            scene_type='comparison',
 85            description="Side-by-side comparison of all controllers"
 86        ))
 87
 88        # Scene 5: Optimization Results
 89        if 'optimization' in project_data:
 90            scenes.append(MovieScene(
 91                title="Parameter Optimization",
 92                duration=20.0,
 93                data=project_data['optimization'],
 94                scene_type='analysis',
 95                description="PSO optimization results and convergence"
 96            ))
 97
 98        # Scene 6: Statistical Analysis
 99        if 'statistics' in project_data:
100            scenes.append(MovieScene(
101                title="Statistical Validation",
102                duration=15.0,
103                data=project_data['statistics'],
104                scene_type='analysis',
105                description="Monte Carlo analysis and confidence intervals"
106            ))
107
108        # Scene 7: Robustness Analysis
109        if 'robustness' in project_data:
110            scenes.append(MovieScene(
111                title="Robustness Analysis",
112                duration=18.0,
113                data=project_data['robustness'],
114                scene_type='analysis',
115                description="System performance under uncertainties"
116            ))
117
118        return scenes
119
120    def _compile_scenes_to_movie(self, scenes: List[MovieScene], output_path: str, fps: int) -> str:
121        """Compile all scenes into a single movie file."""
122
123        # Create individual scene animations
124        scene_files = []
125
126        for i, scene in enumerate(scenes):
127            scene_path = os.path.join(self.output_dir, f"scene_{i:02d}_{scene.title.replace(' ', '_')}.mp4")
128
129            if scene.scene_type == 'animation':
130                self._create_animation_scene(scene, scene_path, fps)
131            elif scene.scene_type == 'static':
132                self._create_static_scene(scene, scene_path, fps)
133            elif scene.scene_type == 'comparison':
134                self._create_comparison_scene(scene, scene_path, fps)
135            elif scene.scene_type == 'analysis':
136                self._create_analysis_scene(scene, scene_path, fps)
137
138            scene_files.append(scene_path)
139
140        # Compile scenes using ffmpeg (if available)
141        try:
142            self._merge_videos(scene_files, output_path)
143        except Exception as e:
144            print(f"Video compilation failed: {e}")
145            print("Individual scene files created successfully:")
146            for file in scene_files:
147                print(f"  - {file}")
148
149        return output_path
150
151    def _create_animation_scene(self, scene: MovieScene, output_path: str, fps: int) -> None:
152        """Create an animated scene."""
153        data = scene.data
154
155        # Extract simulation data
156        time_history = data.get('time', [])
157        state_history = data.get('states', [])
158        control_history = data.get('controls', [])
159
160        if not all([time_history, state_history, control_history]):
161            print(f"Warning: Insufficient data for animation scene '{scene.title}'")
162            return
163
164        # Create animation
165        animator = DIPAnimator(None, figsize=(16, 9))
166
167        # Add title and description
168        animator.fig.suptitle(scene.title, fontsize=20, fontweight='bold')
169        animator.ax.text(0.02, 0.02, scene.description, transform=animator.ax.transAxes,
170                        fontsize=12, bbox=dict(boxstyle="round", facecolor="white", alpha=0.9))
171
172        # Save animation
173        animator.save_animation(state_history, control_history, time_history, output_path, fps=fps)
174
175    def _create_static_scene(self, scene: MovieScene, output_path: str, fps: int) -> None:
176        """Create a static information scene."""
177        fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(16, 9))
178
179        # Create informational slide
180        ax.text(0.5, 0.8, scene.title, ha='center', va='center', fontsize=32, fontweight='bold')
181        ax.text(0.5, 0.6, scene.description, ha='center', va='center', fontsize=18, wrap=True)
182
183        # Add project information
184        if 'project_info' in scene.data:
185            info_text = self._format_project_info(scene.data['project_info'])
186            ax.text(0.5, 0.3, info_text, ha='center', va='center', fontsize=14)
187
188        ax.set_xlim(0, 1)
189        ax.set_ylim(0, 1)
190        ax.axis('off')
191
192        # Save as static video (repeated frames)
193        frames = int(scene.duration * fps)
194
195        def animate_static(frame):
196            return []
197
198        anim = animation.FuncAnimation(fig, animate_static, frames=frames, interval=1000/fps)
199        anim.save(output_path, writer='pillow', fps=fps)
200        plt.close(fig)
201
202    def _create_comparison_scene(self, scene: MovieScene, output_path: str, fps: int) -> None:
203        """Create a controller comparison scene."""
204        data = scene.data
205        controllers = data.get('controllers', {})
206
207        if len(controllers) < 2:
208            print(f"Warning: Not enough controllers for comparison scene '{scene.title}'")
209            return
210
211        # Prepare data for multi-system animation
212        systems_data = []
213        for name, controller_data in controllers.items():
214            systems_data.append((
215                name,
216                controller_data.get('states', []),
217                controller_data.get('controls', []),
218                controller_data.get('time', [])
219            ))
220
221        # Create multi-system animator
222        multi_animator = MultiSystemAnimator(len(systems_data), figsize=(20, 10))
223
224        # Add overall title
225        multi_animator.fig.suptitle(scene.title, fontsize=20, fontweight='bold')
226
227        # Create and save animation
228        anim = multi_animator.create_comparison_animation(systems_data, interval=1000//fps)
229        anim.save(output_path, writer='pillow', fps=fps)
230        plt.close(multi_animator.fig)
231
232    def _create_analysis_scene(self, scene: MovieScene, output_path: str, fps: int) -> None:
233        """Create an analysis visualization scene."""
234        data = scene.data
235
236        # Create analysis plots
237        fig = plt.figure(figsize=(16, 9))
238
239        if scene.title == "Parameter Optimization":
240            self._create_optimization_analysis(fig, data)
241        elif scene.title == "Statistical Validation":
242            self._create_statistical_analysis(fig, data)
243        elif scene.title == "Robustness Analysis":
244            self._create_robustness_analysis(fig, data)
245
246        fig.suptitle(scene.title, fontsize=20, fontweight='bold')
247
248        # Save as animated plot progression
249        frames = int(scene.duration * fps)
250
251        def animate_analysis(frame):
252            # Gradually reveal analysis results
253            alpha = min(1.0, frame / (frames * 0.3))
254            for ax in fig.get_axes():
255                for artist in ax.get_children():
256                    if hasattr(artist, 'set_alpha'):
257                        artist.set_alpha(alpha)
258            return fig.get_children()
259
260        anim = animation.FuncAnimation(fig, animate_analysis, frames=frames, interval=1000/fps)
261        anim.save(output_path, writer='pillow', fps=fps)
262        plt.close(fig)
263
264    def _create_optimization_analysis(self, fig: plt.Figure, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> None:
265        """Create PSO optimization analysis plots."""
266        gs = fig.add_gridspec(2, 2)
267
268        # Convergence plot
269        ax1 = fig.add_subplot(gs[0, :])
270        if 'convergence' in data:
271            ax1.plot(data['convergence'], linewidth=2)
272            ax1.set_title("PSO Convergence")
273            ax1.set_xlabel("Iteration")
274            ax1.set_ylabel("Best Fitness")
275            ax1.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
276
277        # Parameter evolution
278        ax2 = fig.add_subplot(gs[1, 0])
279        if 'parameter_evolution' in data:
280            for i, param_hist in enumerate(data['parameter_evolution']):
281                ax2.plot(param_hist, label=f'Param {i+1}')
282            ax2.set_title("Parameter Evolution")
283            ax2.set_xlabel("Iteration")
284            ax2.legend()
285            ax2.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
286
287        # Final performance
288        ax3 = fig.add_subplot(gs[1, 1])
289        if 'final_performance' in data:
290            performance = data['final_performance']
291            ax3.bar(performance.keys(), performance.values())
292            ax3.set_title("Final Performance Metrics")
293            ax3.tick_params(axis='x', rotation=45)
294
295    def _create_statistical_analysis(self, fig: plt.Figure, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> None:
296        """Create statistical analysis plots."""
297        gs = fig.add_gridspec(2, 2)
298
299        # Performance distributions
300        ax1 = fig.add_subplot(gs[0, :])
301        if 'performance_distributions' in data:
302            for controller, values in data['performance_distributions'].items():
303                ax1.hist(values, alpha=0.7, label=controller, bins=30)
304            ax1.set_title("Performance Distributions")
305            ax1.set_xlabel("Performance Metric")
306            ax1.set_ylabel("Frequency")
307            ax1.legend()
308            ax1.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
309
310        # Confidence intervals
311        ax2 = fig.add_subplot(gs[1, 0])
312        if 'confidence_intervals' in data:
313            controllers = list(data['confidence_intervals'].keys())
314            means = [data['confidence_intervals'][c]['mean'] for c in controllers]
315            errors = [data['confidence_intervals'][c]['error'] for c in controllers]
316            ax2.errorbar(range(len(controllers)), means, yerr=errors, fmt='o', capsize=5)
317            ax2.set_xticks(range(len(controllers)))
318            ax2.set_xticklabels(controllers, rotation=45)
319            ax2.set_title("Performance Confidence Intervals")
320            ax2.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
321
322    def _format_project_info(self, info: Dict[str, Any]) -> str:
323        """Format project information for display."""
324        lines = []
325        for key, value in info.items():
326            lines.append(f"{key}: {value}")
327        return "\n".join(lines)
328
329    def _merge_videos(self, video_files: List[str], output_path: str) -> None:
330        """Merge multiple video files using ffmpeg."""
331        import subprocess
332
333        # Create file list for ffmpeg
334        list_file = os.path.join(self.output_dir, "video_list.txt")
335        with open(list_file, 'w') as f:
336            for video_file in video_files:
337                f.write(f"file '{video_file}'\n")
338
339        # Run ffmpeg
340        cmd = [
341            'ffmpeg', '-f', 'concat', '-safe', '0', '-i', list_file,
342            '-c', 'copy', output_path, '-y'
343        ]
344
345        subprocess.run(cmd, check=True)
346        os.remove(list_file)
347
348    def create_project_trailer(self, project_data: Dict[str, Any], duration: float = 60.0) -> str:
349        """Create a short trailer/summary of the project."""
350        trailer_data = {
351            'overview': project_data.get('overview', {}),
352            'highlights': self._extract_highlights(project_data),
353            'results_summary': self._summarize_results(project_data)
354        }
355
356        trailer_path = os.path.join(self.output_dir, "project_trailer.mp4")
357
358        # Create condensed version of key scenes
359        scenes = [
360            MovieScene("Project Overview", 10.0, trailer_data['overview'], 'static',
361                      "Brief introduction to the DIP control project"),
362            MovieScene("Key Results", 30.0, trailer_data['highlights'], 'comparison',
363                      "Highlights of controller performance"),
364            MovieScene("Summary", 20.0, trailer_data['results_summary'], 'analysis',
365                      "Summary of achievements and conclusions")
366        ]
367
368        return self._compile_scenes_to_movie(scenes, trailer_path, fps=30)
369
370    def _extract_highlights(self, project_data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
371        """Extract highlight results for trailer."""
372        # Select best performing controllers and key results
373        highlights = {}
374
375        if 'controllers' in project_data:
376            # Select top 2-3 performing controllers
377            controllers = project_data['controllers']
378            highlights['controllers'] = dict(list(controllers.items())[:3])
379
380        return highlights
381
382    def _summarize_results(self, project_data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
383        """Summarize key project results."""
384        summary = {}
385
386        if 'final_metrics' in project_data:
387            summary['metrics'] = project_data['final_metrics']
388
389        if 'conclusions' in project_data:
390            summary['conclusions'] = project_data['conclusions']
391
392        return summary
